ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Your Lord will soon give to you and you will be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: For your Lord will certainly give you, and you will be content.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily your Lord will soon give you so amply that you will be well-pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Your Lord will soon grant you sufficient favors to please you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed your Lord will soon give you so much that you will be pleased. (Allah seeks to please the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And verily, your Lord will give you so that you shall be well-pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And soon will your Lord give you so that you shall be well pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Thy Lord shall give thee, and thou shalt be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And verily thy Lord will give unto thee so that thou wilt be content.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: soon you will be gratified with what your Lord will give you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And presently thy Lord shall give Unto thee so that thou shalt be be well-pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Soon your Lord will give you [that with which] you will be pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And soon will thy Guardian-Lord give thee (that wherewith) thou shalt be well-pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And verily, your Lord will give you (all i.e. good) so that you shall be well-pleased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Your Lord will give you, and you will be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And your Lord will give you, and you will be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [93:5] And verily your Lord shall give you, in the Hereafter, of good things, a bounteous gift, and you shall be satisfied, with it — and so the Prophet (s) said, ‘In that case, I shall not be satisfied if a single person from among my community remains in the Fire’ (the response to the oath terminates here, with two affirmations and two negations).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And verily thy Lord will give unto thee) in the Hereafter of intercession (so that thou wilt be content) until you are content.
